forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. West wind 16 to 25 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle shroud of cloudiness lingers in the early hours, cooling the gleaming streets beneath. The chill of 50 degrees wraps around the waking city, carried by a brisk wind from the west, whispering through alleyways and rustling the leaves of the few hardy trees that dot the concrete landscape. The morning air is refreshingly crisp, a prelude to the day ahead, promising the vigorous sunshine that typically accompanies San Francisco afternoons. 

By the time the sun reaches its zenith, the clouds will disperse, giving way to bright blue skies and a high hovering around 60 degrees, peaking at a comfortable 58 later in the day. Take note of the changing winds; they will play an essential role in the comfort of your day. As you step out, a layer is recommended—perhaps a light jacket or a cozy sweater will serve well against the cool gusts. It’s a day made for leisurely strolls along the Embarcadero or a quiet moment in one of the city’s quaint cafés, with a warm drink in hand, watching life unfold around you. 

The forecast urges you to embrace the day’s clarity, where the marine layer retreats to reveal the iconic silhouettes of the Golden Gate and the skyline, beckoning you to explore and breathe in the bracing urban beauty. Each corner holds its charm, waiting for you to discover its secrets, giving a nod to the vibrant pulse of this coastal gem as it unfurls under the early spring sun.
